Name: Admin
Docs:
Admin exports web API functions for the admin web interface. All its methods are
exported under api/. Function calls require valid HTTP Authentication
credentials of a user.

Functions.Name: LoginPrep
Functions.Docs:
LoginPrep returns a login token, and also sets it as cookie. Both must be
present in the call to Login.

Functions.Name: Login
Functions.Docs:
Login returns a session token for the credentials, or fails with error code
"user:badLogin". Call LoginPrep to get a loginToken.

Functions.Name: Logout
Functions.Docs: Logout invalidates the session token.

Functions.Name: Version
Functions.Docs: Version returns the version, goos and goarch.

Functions.Name: CheckDomain
Functions.Docs:
CheckDomain checks the configuration for the domain, such as MX, SMTP STARTTLS,
SPF, DKIM, DMARC, TLSRPT, MTASTS, autoconfig, autodiscover.

Functions.Name: Domains
Functions.Docs: Domains returns all configured domain names.

Functions.Name: Domain
Functions.Docs: Domain returns the dns domain for a (potentially unicode as IDNA) domain name.

Functions.Name: ParseDomain
Functions.Docs: ParseDomain parses a domain, possibly an IDNA domain.

Functions.Name: DomainConfig
Functions.Docs: DomainConfig returns the configuration for a domain.

Functions.Name: DomainLocalparts
Functions.Docs: DomainLocalparts returns the encoded localparts and accounts configured in domain.

Functions.Name: Accounts
Functions.Docs: Accounts returns the names of all configured and all disabled accounts.

Functions.Name: Account
Functions.Docs: Account returns the parsed configuration of an account.

Functions.Name: ConfigFiles
Functions.Docs: ConfigFiles returns the paths and contents of the static and dynamic configuration files.

Functions.Name: MTASTSPolicies
Functions.Docs: MTASTSPolicies returns all mtasts policies from the cache.

Functions.Name: TLSReports
Functions.Docs:
TLSReports returns TLS reports overlapping with period start/end, for the given
policy domain (or all domains if empty). The reports are sorted first by period
end (most recent first), then by policy domain.

Functions.Name: TLSReportID
Functions.Docs: TLSReportID returns a single TLS report.

Functions.Name: TLSRPTSummaries
Functions.Docs:
TLSRPTSummaries returns a summary of received TLS reports overlapping with
period start/end for one or all domains (when domain is empty).
The returned summaries are ordered by domain name.

Functions.Name: DMARCReports
Functions.Docs:
DMARCReports returns DMARC reports overlapping with period start/end, for the
given domain (or all domains if empty). The reports are sorted first by period
end (most recent first), then by domain.

Functions.Name: DMARCReportID
Functions.Docs: DMARCReportID returns a single DMARC report.

Functions.Name: DMARCSummaries
Functions.Docs:
DMARCSummaries returns a summary of received DMARC reports overlapping with
period start/end for one or all domains (when domain is empty).
The returned summaries are ordered by domain name.

Functions.Name: LookupIP
Functions.Docs: LookupIP does a reverse lookup of ip.

Functions.Name: DNSBLStatus
Functions.Docs:
DNSBLStatus returns the IPs from which outgoing connections may be made and
their current status in DNSBLs that are configured. The IPs are typically the
configured listen IPs, or otherwise IPs on the machines network interfaces, with
internal/private IPs removed.

The returned value maps IPs to per DNSBL statuses, where "pass" means not listed and
anything else is an error string, e.g. "fail: ..." or "temperror: ...".

Functions.Name: DomainRecords
Functions.Docs:
DomainRecords returns lines describing DNS records that should exist for the
configured domain.

Functions.Name: DomainAdd
Functions.Docs: DomainAdd adds a new domain and reloads the configuration.

Functions.Name: DomainRemove
Functions.Docs: DomainRemove removes an existing domain and reloads the configuration.

Functions.Name: AccountAdd
Functions.Docs:
AccountAdd adds existing a new account, with an initial email address, and
reloads the configuration.

Functions.Name: AccountRemove
Functions.Docs: AccountRemove removes an existing account and reloads the configuration.

Functions.Name: AddressAdd
Functions.Docs: AddressAdd adds a new address to the account, which must already exist.

Functions.Name: AddressRemove
Functions.Docs: AddressRemove removes an existing address.

Functions.Name: SetPassword
Functions.Docs:
SetPassword saves a new password for an account, invalidating the previous password.
Sessions are not interrupted, and will keep working. New login attempts must use the new password.
Password must be at least 8 characters.

Functions.Name: AccountSettingsSave
Functions.Docs: AccountSettingsSave set new settings for an account that only an admin can set.

Functions.Name: AccountLoginDisabledSave
Functions.Docs: AccountLoginDisabledSave saves the LoginDisabled field of an account.

Functions.Name: ClientConfigsDomain
Functions.Docs:
ClientConfigsDomain returns configurations for email clients, IMAP and
Submission (SMTP) for the domain.

Functions.Name: QueueSize
Functions.Docs: QueueSize returns the number of messages currently in the outgoing queue.

Functions.Name: QueueHoldRuleList
Functions.Docs: QueueHoldRuleList lists the hold rules.

Functions.Name: QueueHoldRuleAdd
Functions.Docs:
QueueHoldRuleAdd adds a hold rule. Newly submitted and existing messages
matching the hold rule will be marked "on hold".

Functions.Name: QueueHoldRuleRemove
Functions.Docs:
QueueHoldRuleRemove removes a hold rule. The Hold field of messages in
the queue are not changed.

Functions.Name: QueueList
Functions.Docs: QueueList returns the messages currently in the outgoing queue.

Functions.Name: QueueNextAttemptSet
Functions.Docs:
QueueNextAttemptSet sets a new time for next delivery attempt of matching
messages from the queue.

Functions.Name: QueueNextAttemptAdd
Functions.Docs:
QueueNextAttemptAdd adds a duration to the time of next delivery attempt of
matching messages from the queue.

Functions.Name: QueueHoldSet
Functions.Docs: QueueHoldSet sets the Hold field of matching messages in the queue.

Functions.Name: QueueFail
Functions.Docs: QueueFail fails delivery for matching messages, causing DSNs to be sent.

Functions.Name: QueueDrop
Functions.Docs: QueueDrop removes matching messages from the queue.

Functions.Name: QueueRequireTLSSet
Functions.Docs:
QueueRequireTLSSet updates the requiretls field for matching messages in the
queue, to be used for the next delivery.

Functions.Name: QueueTransportSet
Functions.Docs:
QueueTransportSet initiates delivery of a message from the queue and sets the transport
to use for delivery.

Functions.Name: RetiredList
Functions.Docs:
RetiredList returns messages retired from the queue (delivery could
have succeeded or failed).

Functions.Name: HookQueueSize
Functions.Docs: HookQueueSize returns the number of webhooks still to be delivered.

Functions.Name: HookList
Functions.Docs: HookList lists webhooks still to be delivered.

Functions.Name: HookNextAttemptSet
Functions.Docs:
HookNextAttemptSet sets a new time for next delivery attempt of matching
hooks from the queue.

Functions.Name: HookNextAttemptAdd
Functions.Docs:
HookNextAttemptAdd adds a duration to the time of next delivery attempt of
matching hooks from the queue.

Functions.Name: HookRetiredList
Functions.Docs: HookRetiredList lists retired webhooks.

Functions.Name: HookCancel
Functions.Docs: HookCancel prevents further delivery attempts of matching webhooks.

Functions.Name: LogLevels
Functions.Docs: LogLevels returns the current log levels.

Functions.Name: LogLevelSet
Functions.Docs: LogLevelSet sets a log level for a package.

Functions.Name: LogLevelRemove
Functions.Docs: LogLevelRemove removes a log level for a package, which cannot be the empty string.

Functions.Name: CheckUpdatesEnabled
Functions.Docs: CheckUpdatesEnabled returns whether checking for updates is enabled.

Functions.Name: WebserverConfig
Functions.Docs: WebserverConfig returns the current webserver config

Functions.Name: WebserverConfigSave
Functions.Docs:
WebserverConfigSave saves a new webserver config. If oldConf is not equal to
the current config, an error is returned.

Functions.Name: Transports
Functions.Docs: Transports returns the configured transports, for sending email.

Functions.Name: DMARCEvaluationStats
Functions.Docs:
DMARCEvaluationStats returns a map of all domains with evaluations to a count of
the evaluations and whether those evaluations will cause a report to be sent.

Functions.Name: DMARCEvaluationsDomain
Functions.Docs:
DMARCEvaluationsDomain returns all evaluations for aggregate reports for the
domain, sorted from oldest to most recent.

Functions.Name: DMARCRemoveEvaluations
Functions.Docs: DMARCRemoveEvaluations removes evaluations for a domain.

Functions.Name: DMARCSuppressAdd
Functions.Docs:
DMARCSuppressAdd adds a reporting address to the suppress list. Outgoing
reports will be suppressed for a period.

Functions.Name: DMARCSuppressList
Functions.Docs: DMARCSuppressList returns all reporting addresses on the suppress list.

Functions.Name: DMARCSuppressRemove
Functions.Docs: DMARCSuppressRemove removes a reporting address record from the suppress list.

Functions.Name: DMARCSuppressExtend
Functions.Docs: DMARCSuppressExtend updates the until field of a suppressed reporting address record.

Functions.Name: TLSRPTResults
Functions.Docs: TLSRPTResults returns all TLSRPT results in the database.

Functions.Name: TLSRPTResultsDomain
Functions.Docs: TLSRPTResultsPolicyDomain returns the TLS results for a domain.

Functions.Name: LookupTLSRPTRecord
Functions.Docs:
LookupTLSRPTRecord looks up a TLSRPT record and returns the parsed form, original txt
form from DNS, and error with the TLSRPT record as a string.

Functions.Name: TLSRPTRemoveResults
Functions.Docs:
TLSRPTRemoveResults removes the TLS results for a domain for the given day. If
day is empty, all results are removed.

Functions.Name: TLSRPTSuppressAdd
Functions.Docs:
TLSRPTSuppressAdd adds a reporting address to the suppress list. Outgoing
reports will be suppressed for a period.

Functions.Name: TLSRPTSuppressList
Functions.Docs: TLSRPTSuppressList returns all reporting addresses on the suppress list.

Functions.Name: TLSRPTSuppressRemove
Functions.Docs: TLSRPTSuppressRemove removes a reporting address record from the suppress list.

Functions.Name: TLSRPTSuppressExtend
Functions.Docs: TLSRPTSuppressExtend updates the until field of a suppressed reporting address record.

Functions.Name: LookupCid
Functions.Docs: LookupCid turns an ID from a Received header into a cid as used in logging.

Functions.Name: Config
Functions.Docs: Config returns the dynamic config.

Functions.Name: AccountRoutesSave
Functions.Docs: AccountRoutesSave saves routes for an account.

Functions.Name: DomainRoutesSave
Functions.Docs: DomainRoutesSave saves routes for a domain.

Functions.Name: RoutesSave
Functions.Docs: RoutesSave saves global routes.

Functions.Name: DomainDescriptionSave
Functions.Docs: DomainDescriptionSave saves the description for a domain.

Functions.Name: DomainClientSettingsDomainSave
Functions.Docs: DomainClientSettingsDomainSave saves the client settings domain for a domain.

Functions.Name: DomainLocalpartConfigSave
Functions.Docs:
DomainLocalpartConfigSave saves the localpart catchall and case-sensitive
settings for a domain.

Functions.Name: DomainDMARCAddressSave
Functions.Docs:
DomainDMARCAddressSave saves the DMARC reporting address/processing
configuration for a domain. If localpart is empty, processing reports is
disabled.

Functions.Name: DomainTLSRPTAddressSave
Functions.Docs:
DomainTLSRPTAddressSave saves the TLS reporting address/processing
configuration for a domain. If localpart is empty, processing reports is
disabled.

Functions.Name: DomainMTASTSSave
Functions.Docs:
DomainMTASTSSave saves the MTASTS policy for a domain. If policyID is empty,
no MTASTS policy is served.

Functions.Name: DomainDKIMAdd
Functions.Docs:
DomainDKIMAdd adds a DKIM selector for a domain, generating a new private
key. The selector is not enabled for signing.

Functions.Name: DomainDKIMRemove
Functions.Docs: DomainDKIMRemove removes a DKIM selector for a domain.

Functions.Name: DomainDKIMSave
Functions.Docs:
DomainDKIMSave saves the settings of selectors, and which to enable for
signing, for a domain. All currently configured selectors must be present,
selectors cannot be added/removed with this function.

Functions.Name: DomainDisabledSave
Functions.Docs:
DomainDisabledSave saves the Disabled field of a domain. A disabled domain
rejects incoming/outgoing messages involving the domain and does not request new
TLS certificats with ACME.

Structs.Name: CheckResult
Structs.Docs:
CheckResult is the analysis of a domain, its actual configuration (DNS, TLS,
connectivity) and the mox configuration. It includes configuration instructions
(e.g. DNS records), and warnings and errors encountered.

Fields.Name: Hostname
Fields.Docs: This hostname, IPs must resolve back to this.

Fields.Name: IPNames
Fields.Docs: IP to names.

Structs.Name: Domain
Structs.Docs:
Domain is a domain name, with one or more labels, with at least an ASCII
representation, and for IDNA non-ASCII domains a unicode representation.
The ASCII string must be used for DNS lookups. The strings do not have a
trailing dot. When using with StrictResolver, add the trailing dot.

Fields.Name: ASCII
Fields.Docs: A non-unicode domain, e.g. with A-labels (xn--...) or NR-LDH (non-reserved letters/digits/hyphens) labels. Always in lower case. No trailing dot.

Fields.Name: Unicode
Fields.Docs: Name as U-labels, in Unicode NFC. Empty if this is an ASCII-only domain. No trailing dot.

Fields.Name: Version
Fields.Docs: Must be "spf1".

Fields.Name: Directives
Fields.Docs: An IP is evaluated against each directive until a match is found.

Fields.Name: Redirect
Fields.Docs: Modifier that redirects SPF checks to other domain after directives did not match. Optional. For "redirect=".

Fields.Name: Explanation
Fields.Docs: Modifier for creating a user-friendly error message when an IP results in status "fail".

Fields.Name: Other
Fields.Docs: Other modifiers.

Structs.Name: Directive
Structs.Docs:
Directive consists of a mechanism that describes how to check if an IP matches,
an (optional) qualifier indicating the policy for a match, and optional
parameters specific to the mechanism.

Fields.Name: Qualifier
Fields.Docs: Sets the result if this directive matches. "" and "+" are "pass", "-" is "fail", "?" is "neutral", "~" is "softfail".

Fields.Name: Mechanism
Fields.Docs: "all", "include", "a", "mx", "ptr", "ip4", "ip6", "exists".

Fields.Name: DomainSpec
Fields.Docs: For include, a, mx, ptr, exists. Always in lower-case when parsed using ParseRecord.

Fields.Name: IPstr
Fields.Docs: Original string for IP, always with /subnet.

Fields.Name: IP4CIDRLen
Fields.Docs: For a, mx, ip4.

Fields.Name: IP6CIDRLen
Fields.Docs: For a, mx, ip6.

Structs.Name: Modifier
Structs.Docs:
Modifier provides additional information for a policy.
"redirect" and "exp" are not represented as a Modifier but explicitly in a Record.

Fields.Name: Key
Fields.Docs: Key is case-insensitive.

Structs.Name: Record
Structs.Docs:
Record is a DKIM DNS record, served on <selector>._domainkey.<domain> for a
given selector and domain (s= and d= in the DKIM-Signature).

The record is a semicolon-separated list of "="-separated field value pairs.
Strings should be compared case-insensitively, e.g. k=ed25519 is equivalent to k=ED25519.

Example:

	v=DKIM1;h=sha256;k=ed25519;p=ln5zd/JEX4Jy60WAhUOv33IYm2YZMyTQAdr9stML504=

Fields.Name: Version
Fields.Docs: Version, fixed "DKIM1" (case sensitive). Field "v".

Fields.Name: Hashes
Fields.Docs: Acceptable hash algorithms, e.g. "sha1", "sha256". Optional, defaults to all algorithms. Field "h".

Fields.Name: Key
Fields.Docs: Key type, "rsa" or "ed25519". Optional, default "rsa". Field "k".

Fields.Name: Notes
Fields.Docs: Debug notes. Field "n".

Fields.Name: Pubkey
Fields.Docs: Public key, as base64 in record. If empty, the key has been revoked. Field "p".

Fields.Name: Services
Fields.Docs: Service types. Optional, default "*" for all services. Other values: "email". Field "s".

Fields.Name: Flags
Fields.Docs: Flags, colon-separated. Optional, default is no flags. Other values: "y" for testing DKIM, "s" for "i=" must have same domain as "d" in signatures. Field "t".

Fields.Name: Version
Fields.Docs: "v=DMARC1", fixed.

Fields.Name: Policy
Fields.Docs: Required, for "p=".

Fields.Name: SubdomainPolicy
Fields.Docs: Like policy but for subdomains. Optional, for "sp=".

Fields.Name: AggregateReportAddresses
Fields.Docs: Optional, for "rua=". Destination addresses for aggregate reports.

Fields.Name: FailureReportAddresses
Fields.Docs: Optional, for "ruf=". Destination addresses for failure reports.

Fields.Name: ADKIM
Fields.Docs: Alignment: "r" (default) for relaxed or "s" for simple. For "adkim=".

Fields.Name: ASPF
Fields.Docs: Alignment: "r" (default) for relaxed or "s" for simple. For "aspf=".

Fields.Name: AggregateReportingInterval
Fields.Docs: In seconds, default 86400. For "ri="

Fields.Name: FailureReportingOptions
Fields.Docs: "0" (default), "1", "d", "s". For "fo=".

Fields.Name: ReportingFormat
Fields.Docs: "afrf" (default). For "rf=".

Fields.Name: Percentage
Fields.Docs: Between 0 and 100, default 100. For "pct=". Policy applies randomly to this percentage of messages.

Structs.Name: URI
Structs.Docs: URI is a destination address for reporting.

Fields.Name: Address
Fields.Docs: Should start with "mailto:".

Fields.Name: MaxSize
Fields.Docs: Optional maximum message size, subject to Unit.

Fields.Name: Unit
Fields.Docs: "" (b), "k", "m", "g", "t" (case insensitive), unit size, where k is 2^10 etc.

Fields.Name: Version
Fields.Docs: "TLSRPTv1", for "v=".

Fields.Name: RUAs
Fields.Docs: Aggregate reporting URI, for "rua=". "rua=" can occur multiple times, each can be a list.

Structs.Name: Extension
Structs.Docs: Extension is an additional key/value pair for a TLSRPT record.

Fields.Name: Version
Fields.Docs: "STSv1", for "v=". Required.

Fields.Name: ID
Fields.Docs: Record version, for "id=". Required.

Fields.Name: Extensions
Fields.Docs: Optional extensions.

Structs.Name: Pair
Structs.Docs: Pair is an extension key/value pair in a MTA-STS DNS record or policy.

Structs.Name: Policy
Structs.Docs: Policy is an MTA-STS policy as served at "https://mta-sts.<domain>/.well-known/mta-sts.txt".

Fields.Name: Version
Fields.Docs: "STSv1"

Fields.Name: MaxAgeSeconds
Fields.Docs: How long this policy can be cached. Suggested values are in weeks or more.

Structs.Name: STSMX
Structs.Docs: MX is an allowlisted MX host name/pattern.

Fields.Name: Wildcard
Fields.Docs: "*." wildcard, e.g. if a subdomain matches. A wildcard must match exactly one label. *.example.com matches mail.example.com, but not example.com, and not foor.bar.example.com.

Fields.Name: SRVs
Fields.Docs: Service (e.g. "_imaps") to records.

Structs.Name: SRV
Structs.Docs: An SRV represents a single DNS SRV record.

Fields.Name: LocalpartCatchallSeparatorsEffective
Fields.Docs: Either LocalpartCatchallSeparators, the value of LocalpartCatchallSeparator, or empty.

Fields.Name: HeadersEffective
Fields.Docs: Used when signing. Based on Headers from config, or the reasonable default.

Fields.Name: Algorithm
Fields.Docs: "ed25519", "rsa-*", based on private key.

Fields.Name: ParsedLocalpart
Fields.Docs: Lower-case if case-sensitivity is not configured for domain. Not "canonical" for catchall separators for backwards compatibility.

Fields.Name: DNSDomain
Fields.Docs: Effective domain, always set based on Domain field or Domain where this is configured.

Fields.Name: ParsedLocalpart
Fields.Docs: Lower-case if case-sensitivity is not configured for domain. Not "canonical" for catchall separators for backwards compatibility.

Fields.Name: DNSDomain
Fields.Docs: Effective domain, always set based on Domain field or Domain where this is configured.

Fields.Name: LocalpartStr
Fields.Docs: In encoded form.

Fields.Name: ParsedAddresses
Fields.Docs: Matches addresses.

Fields.Name: Address
Fields.Docs: Parsed address.

Fields.Name: AccountName
Fields.Docs: Looked up.

Fields.Name: Destination
Fields.Docs: Belonging to address.

Structs.Name: Address
Structs.Docs: Address is a parsed email address.

Fields.Name: Domain
Fields.Docs: todo: shouldn't we accept an ip address here too? and merge this type into smtp.Path.

Fields.Name: IsForward
Fields.Docs: todo: once we implement ARC, we can use dkim domains that we cannot verify but that the arc-verified forwarding mail server was able to verify.

Fields.Name: JunkFilter
Fields.Docs: todo: sane defaults for junkfilter

Fields.Name: DNSDomain
Fields.Docs: Parsed form of Domain.

Fields.Name: Period
Fields.Docs: todo: have a reasonable default for this?

Fields.Name: Alias
Fields.Docs: Without members.

Fields.Name: MemberAddresses
Fields.Docs: Only if allowed to see.

Structs.Name: PolicyRecord
Structs.Docs: PolicyRecord is a cached policy or absence of a policy.

Fields.Name: Domain
Fields.Docs: Domain name, with unicode characters.

Fields.Name: LastUpdate
Fields.Docs: Policies are refreshed on use and periodically.

Fields.Name: RecordID
Fields.Docs: As retrieved from DNS.

Fields.Name: Version
Fields.Docs: "STSv1"

Fields.Name: MaxAgeSeconds
Fields.Docs: How long this policy can be cached. Suggested values are in weeks or more.

Fields.Name: PolicyText
Fields.Docs: Text that make up the policy, as retrieved. We didn't store this in the past. If empty, policy can be reconstructed from Policy field. Needed by TLSRPT.

Structs.Name: TLSReportRecord
Structs.Docs:
Record is a TLS report as a database record, including information
about the sender.

Fields.Name: Domain
Fields.Docs: Policy domain to which the TLS report applies. Unicode.

Fields.Name: HostReport
Fields.Docs: Report for host TLSRPT record, as opposed to domain TLSRPT record.

Structs.Name: Report
Structs.Docs: Report is a TLSRPT report.

Structs.Name: TLSRPTDateRange
Structs.Docs: note: with TLSRPT prefix to prevent clash in sherpadoc types.

Fields.Name: Domain
Fields.Docs: ASCII/A-labels, ../rfc/8460:704

Structs.Name: TLSRPTSummary
Structs.Docs:
TLSRPTSummary presents TLS reporting statistics for a single domain
over a period.

Structs.Name: DomainFeedback
Structs.Docs: DomainFeedback is a single report stored in the database.

Fields.Name: Domain
Fields.Docs: Domain where DMARC DNS record was found, could be organizational domain.

Fields.Name: FromDomain
Fields.Docs: Domain in From-header.

Structs.Name: PolicyPublished
Structs.Docs: PolicyPublished is the policy as found in DNS for the domain.

Fields.Name: Domain
Fields.Docs: Domain is where DMARC record was found, not necessarily message From. Reports we generate use unicode names, incoming reports may have either ASCII-only or Unicode domains.

Structs.Name: DMARCSummary
Structs.Docs:
DMARCSummary presents DMARC aggregate reporting statistics for a single domain
over a period.

Structs.Name: Reverse
Structs.Docs: Reverse is the result of a reverse lookup.

Structs.Name: ClientConfigs
Structs.Docs:
ClientConfigs holds the client configuration for IMAP/Submission for a
domain.

Structs.Name: HoldRule
Structs.Docs:
HoldRule is a set of conditions that cause a matching message to be marked as on
hold when it is queued. All-empty conditions matches all messages, effectively
pausing the entire queue.

Fields.Name: SenderDomainStr
Fields.Docs: Unicode.

Fields.Name: RecipientDomainStr
Fields.Docs: Unicode.

Structs.Name: Filter
Structs.Docs:
Filter filters messages to list or operate on. Used by admin web interface
and cli.

Only non-empty/non-zero values are applied to the filter. Leaving all fields
empty/zero matches all messages.

Fields.Name: Submitted
Fields.Docs: Whether submitted before/after a time relative to now. ">$duration" or "<$duration", also with "now" for duration.

Fields.Name: NextAttempt
Fields.Docs: ">$duration" or "<$duration", also with "now" for duration.

Fields.Name: Field
Fields.Docs: "Queued" or "NextAttempt"/"".

Fields.Name: LastID
Fields.Docs: If > 0, we return objects beyond this, less/greater depending on Asc.

Fields.Name: Last
Fields.Docs: Value of Field for last object. Must be set iff LastID is set.

Fields.Name: Asc
Fields.Docs: Ascending, or descending.

Structs.Name: Msg
Structs.Docs:
Msg is a message in the queue.

Use MakeMsg to make a message with fields that Add needs. Add will further set
queueing related fields.

Fields.Name: BaseID
Fields.Docs: A message for multiple recipients will get a BaseID that is identical to the first Msg.ID queued. The message contents will be identical for each recipient, including MsgPrefix. If other properties are identical too, including recipient domain, multiple Msgs may be delivered in a single SMTP transaction. For messages with a single recipient, this field will be 0.

Fields.Name: Hold
Fields.Docs: If set, delivery won't be attempted.

Fields.Name: SenderAccount
Fields.Docs: Failures are delivered back to this local account. Also used for routing.

Fields.Name: SenderLocalpart
Fields.Docs: Should be a local user and domain.

Fields.Name: SenderDomainStr
Fields.Docs: For filtering, unicode.

Fields.Name: FromID
Fields.Docs: For transactional messages, used to match later DSNs.

Fields.Name: RecipientLocalpart
Fields.Docs: Typically a remote user and domain.

Fields.Name: RecipientDomainStr
Fields.Docs: For filtering, unicode domain. Can also contain ip enclosed in [].

Fields.Name: Attempts
Fields.Docs: Next attempt is based on last attempt and exponential back off based on attempts.

Fields.Name: MaxAttempts
Fields.Docs: Max number of attempts before giving up. If 0, then the default of 8 attempts is used instead.

Fields.Name: DialedIPs
Fields.Docs: For each host, the IPs that were dialed. Used for IP selection for later attempts.

Fields.Name: NextAttempt
Fields.Docs: For scheduling.

Fields.Name: Has8bit
Fields.Docs: Whether message contains bytes with high bit set, determines whether 8BITMIME SMTP extension is needed.

Fields.Name: SMTPUTF8
Fields.Docs: Whether message requires use of SMTPUTF8.

Fields.Name: IsDMARCReport
Fields.Docs: Delivery failures for DMARC reports are handled differently.

Fields.Name: IsTLSReport
Fields.Docs: Delivery failures for TLS reports are handled differently.

Fields.Name: Size
Fields.Docs: Full size of message, combined MsgPrefix with contents of message file.

Fields.Name: MessageID
Fields.Docs: Message-ID header, including <>. Used when composing a DSN, in its References header.

Fields.Name: MsgPrefix
Fields.Docs: Data to send before the contents from the file, typically with headers like DKIM-Signature.

Fields.Name: Subject
Fields.Docs: For context about delivery.

Fields.Name: DSNUTF8
Fields.Docs: If set, this message is a DSN and this is a version using utf-8, for the case the remote MTA supports smtputf8. In this case, Size and MsgPrefix are not relevant.

Fields.Name: Transport
Fields.Docs: If non-empty, the transport to use for this message. Can be set through cli or admin interface. If empty (the default for a submitted message), regular routing rules apply.

Fields.Name: RequireTLS
Fields.Docs: RequireTLS influences TLS verification during delivery.  If nil, the recipient domain policy is followed (MTA-STS and/or DANE), falling back to optional opportunistic non-verified STARTTLS.  If RequireTLS is true (through SMTP REQUIRETLS extension or webmail submit), MTA-STS or DANE is required, as well as REQUIRETLS support by the next hop server.  If RequireTLS is false (through messag header "TLS-Required: No"), the recipient domain's policy is ignored if it does not lead to a successful TLS connection, i.e. falling back to SMTP delivery with unverified STARTTLS or plain text.

Fields.Name: FutureReleaseRequest
Fields.Docs: For DSNs, where the original FUTURERELEASE value must be included as per-message field. This field should be of the form "for;" plus interval, or "until;" plus utc date-time.

Fields.Name: Extra
Fields.Docs: Extra information, for transactional email.

Structs.Name: IPDomain
Structs.Docs: IPDomain is an ip address, a domain, or empty.

Structs.Name: MsgResult
Structs.Docs: MsgResult is the result (or work in progress) of a delivery attempt.

Structs.Name: RetiredFilter
Structs.Docs:
RetiredFilter filters messages to list or operate on. Used by admin web interface
and cli.

Only non-empty/non-zero values are applied to the filter. Leaving all fields
empty/zero matches all messages.

Fields.Name: Submitted
Fields.Docs: Whether submitted before/after a time relative to now. ">$duration" or "<$duration", also with "now" for duration.

Fields.Name: LastActivity
Fields.Docs: ">$duration" or "<$duration", also with "now" for duration.

Fields.Name: Field
Fields.Docs: "Queued" or "LastActivity"/"".

Fields.Name: LastID
Fields.Docs: If > 0, we return objects beyond this, less/greater depending on Asc.

Fields.Name: Last
Fields.Docs: Value of Field for last object. Must be set iff LastID is set.

Fields.Name: Asc
Fields.Docs: Ascending, or descending.

Structs.Name: MsgRetired
Structs.Docs:
MsgRetired is a message for which delivery completed, either successful,
failed/canceled. Retired messages are only stored if so configured, and will be
cleaned up after the configured period.

Fields.Name: ID
Fields.Docs: Same ID as it was as Msg.ID.

Fields.Name: SenderAccount
Fields.Docs: Failures are delivered back to this local account. Also used for routing.

Fields.Name: SenderLocalpart
Fields.Docs: Should be a local user and domain.

Fields.Name: SenderDomainStr
Fields.Docs: For filtering, unicode.

Fields.Name: FromID
Fields.Docs: Used to match DSNs.

Fields.Name: RecipientLocalpart
Fields.Docs: Typically a remote user and domain.

Fields.Name: RecipientDomainStr
Fields.Docs: For filtering, unicode.

Fields.Name: Attempts
Fields.Docs: Next attempt is based on last attempt and exponential back off based on attempts.

Fields.Name: MaxAttempts
Fields.Docs: Max number of attempts before giving up. If 0, then the default of 8 attempts is used instead.

Fields.Name: DialedIPs
Fields.Docs: For each host, the IPs that were dialed. Used for IP selection for later attempts.

Fields.Name: Has8bit
Fields.Docs: Whether message contains bytes with high bit set, determines whether 8BITMIME SMTP extension is needed.

Fields.Name: SMTPUTF8
Fields.Docs: Whether message requires use of SMTPUTF8.

Fields.Name: IsDMARCReport
Fields.Docs: Delivery failures for DMARC reports are handled differently.

Fields.Name: IsTLSReport
Fields.Docs: Delivery failures for TLS reports are handled differently.

Fields.Name: Size
Fields.Docs: Full size of message, combined MsgPrefix with contents of message file.

Fields.Name: MessageID
Fields.Docs: Used when composing a DSN, in its References header.

Fields.Name: Subject
Fields.Docs: For context about delivery.

Fields.Name: Extra
Fields.Docs: Extra information, for transactional email.

Fields.Name: Success
Fields.Docs: Whether delivery to next hop succeeded.

Structs.Name: HookFilter
Structs.Docs:
HookFilter filters messages to list or operate on. Used by admin web interface
and cli.

Only non-empty/non-zero values are applied to the filter. Leaving all fields
empty/zero matches all hooks.

Fields.Name: Submitted
Fields.Docs: Whether submitted before/after a time relative to now. ">$duration" or "<$duration", also with "now" for duration.

Fields.Name: NextAttempt
Fields.Docs: ">$duration" or "<$duration", also with "now" for duration.

Fields.Name: Event
Fields.Docs: Including "incoming".

Fields.Name: Field
Fields.Docs: "Queued" or "NextAttempt"/"".

Fields.Name: LastID
Fields.Docs: If > 0, we return objects beyond this, less/greater depending on Asc.

Fields.Name: Last
Fields.Docs: Value of Field for last object. Must be set iff LastID is set.

Fields.Name: Asc
Fields.Docs: Ascending, or descending.

Structs.Name: Hook
Structs.Docs: Hook is a webhook call about a delivery. We'll try delivering with backoff until we succeed or fail.

Fields.Name: QueueMsgID
Fields.Docs: Original queue Msg/MsgRetired ID. Zero for hooks for incoming messages.

Fields.Name: FromID
Fields.Docs: As generated by us and returned in webapi call. Can be empty, for incoming messages to our base address.

Fields.Name: MessageID
Fields.Docs: Of outgoing or incoming messages. Includes <>.

Fields.Name: Subject
Fields.Docs: Subject of original outgoing message, or of incoming message.

Fields.Name: Extra
Fields.Docs: From submitted message.

Fields.Name: URL
Fields.Docs: Taken from config when webhook is scheduled.

Fields.Name: Authorization
Fields.Docs: Optional value for authorization header to include in HTTP request.

Fields.Name: OutgoingEvent
Fields.Docs: Empty string if not outgoing.

Fields.Name: Payload
Fields.Docs: JSON data to be submitted.

Fields.Name: NextAttempt
Fields.Docs: Index for fast scheduling.

Structs.Name: HookResult
Structs.Docs: HookResult is the result of a single attempt to deliver a webhook.

Fields.Name: Code
Fields.Docs: eg 200, 404, 500. 2xx implies success.

Fields.Name: Response
Fields.Docs: Max 512 bytes of HTTP response body.

Structs.Name: HookRetiredFilter
Structs.Docs:
HookRetiredFilter filters messages to list or operate on. Used by admin web interface
and cli.

Only non-empty/non-zero values are applied to the filter. Leaving all fields
empty/zero matches all hooks.

Fields.Name: Submitted
Fields.Docs: Whether submitted before/after a time relative to now. ">$duration" or "<$duration", also with "now" for duration.

Fields.Name: LastActivity
Fields.Docs: ">$duration" or "<$duration", also with "now" for duration.

Fields.Name: Event
Fields.Docs: Including "incoming".

Fields.Name: Field
Fields.Docs: "Queued" or "LastActivity"/"".

Fields.Name: LastID
Fields.Docs: If > 0, we return objects beyond this, less/greater depending on Asc.

Fields.Name: Last
Fields.Docs: Value of Field for last object. Must be set iff LastID is set.

Fields.Name: Asc
Fields.Docs: Ascending, or descending.

Structs.Name: HookRetired
Structs.Docs:
HookRetired is a Hook that was delivered/failed/canceled and kept according
to the configuration.

Fields.Name: ID
Fields.Docs: Same as original Hook.ID.

Fields.Name: QueueMsgID
Fields.Docs: Original queue Msg or MsgRetired ID. Zero for hooks for incoming messages.

Fields.Name: FromID
Fields.Docs: As generated by us and returned in webapi call. Can be empty, for incoming messages to our base address.

Fields.Name: MessageID
Fields.Docs: Of outgoing or incoming messages. Includes <>.

Fields.Name: Subject
Fields.Docs: Subject of original outgoing message, or of incoming message.

Fields.Name: Extra
Fields.Docs: From submitted message.

Fields.Name: URL
Fields.Docs: Taken from config at start of each attempt.

Fields.Name: Authorization
Fields.Docs: Whether request had authorization without keeping it around.

Fields.Name: Payload
Fields.Docs: JSON data submitted.

Fields.Name: SupersededByID
Fields.Docs: If not 0, a Hook.ID that superseded this one and Done will be true.

Structs.Name: WebserverConfig
Structs.Docs:
WebserverConfig is the combination of WebDomainRedirects and WebHandlers
from the domains.conf configuration file.

Fields.Name: WebDNSDomainRedirects
Fields.Docs: From server to frontend.

Fields.Name: WebDomainRedirects
Fields.Docs: From frontend to server, it's not convenient to create dns.Domain in the frontend.

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Docs: Either LogName, or numeric index if LogName was empty. Used instead of LogName in logging/metrics.

Structs.Name: Transport
Structs.Docs:
Transport is a method to delivery a message. At most one of the fields can
be non-nil. The non-nil field represents the type of transport. For a
transport with all fields nil, regular email delivery is done.

Structs.Name: TransportSMTP
Structs.Docs:
TransportSMTP delivers messages by "submission" (SMTP, typically
authenticated) to the queue of a remote host (smarthost), or by relaying
(SMTP, typically unauthenticated).

Structs.Name: SMTPAuth
Structs.Docs:
SMTPAuth hold authentication credentials used when delivering messages
through a smarthost.

Structs.Name: TransportFail
Structs.Docs: TransportFail is a transport that fails all delivery attempts.

Fields.Name: Code
Fields.Docs: Effective values to use, set when parsing.

Structs.Name: EvaluationStat
Structs.Docs:
EvaluationStat summarizes stored evaluations, for inclusion in an upcoming
aggregate report, for a domain.

Structs.Name: Evaluation
Structs.Docs:
Evaluation is the result of an evaluation of a DMARC policy, to be included
in a DMARC report.

Fields.Name: PolicyDomain
Fields.Docs: Domain where DMARC policy was found, could be the organizational domain while evaluation was for a subdomain. Unicode. Same as domain found in PolicyPublished. A separate field for its index.

Fields.Name: Evaluated
Fields.Docs: Time of evaluation, determines which report (covering whole hours) this evaluation will be included in.

Fields.Name: Optional
Fields.Docs: If optional, this evaluation is not a reason to send a DMARC report, but it will be included when a report is sent due to other non-optional evaluations. Set for evaluations of incoming DMARC reports. We don't want such deliveries causing us to send a report, or we would keep exchanging reporting messages forever. Also set for when evaluation is a DMARC reject for domains we haven't positively interacted with, to prevent being used to flood an unsuspecting domain with reports.

Fields.Name: IntervalHours
Fields.Docs: Effective aggregate reporting interval in hours. Between 1 and 24, rounded up from seconds from policy to first number that can divide 24.

Fields.Name: Addresses
Fields.Docs: "rua" in DMARC record, we only store evaluations for records with aggregate reporting addresses, so always non-empty.

Fields.Name: PolicyPublished
Fields.Docs: Policy used for evaluation. We don't store the "fo" field for failure reporting options, since we don't send failure reports for individual messages.

Fields.Name: SourceIP
Fields.Docs: For "row" in a report record.

Fields.Name: EnvelopeTo
Fields.Docs: For "identifiers" in a report record.

Fields.Name: DKIMResults
Fields.Docs: For "auth_results" in a report record.

Structs.Name: SuppressAddress
Structs.Docs:
SuppressAddress is a reporting address for which outgoing DMARC reports
will be suppressed for a period.

Structs.Name: TLSResult
Structs.Docs:
TLSResult is stored in the database to track TLS results per policy domain, day
and recipient domain. These records will be included in TLS reports.

Fields.Name: PolicyDomain
Fields.Docs: Domain potentially with TLSRPT DNS record, with addresses that will receive reports. Either a recipient domain (for MTA-STS policies) or an (MX) host (for DANE policies). Unicode.

Fields.Name: DayUTC
Fields.Docs: DayUTC is of the form yyyymmdd.

Fields.Name: RecipientDomain
Fields.Docs: Reports are sent per recipient domain and per MX host. For reports to a recipient domain, we type send a result for MTA-STS and one or more MX host (DANE) results. Unicode.

Fields.Name: IsHost
Fields.Docs: Result is for MX host (DANE), not recipient domain (MTA-STS).

Fields.Name: SendReport
Fields.Docs: Whether to send a report. TLS results for delivering messages with TLS reports will be recorded, but will not cause a report to be sent.

Fields.Name: SentToRecipientDomain
Fields.Docs: Set after sending to recipient domain, before sending results to policy domain (after which the record is removed).

Fields.Name: RecipientDomainReportingAddresses
Fields.Docs: Reporting addresses from the recipient domain TLSRPT record, not necessarily those we sent to (e.g. due to failure). Used to leave results to MX target (DANE) policy domains out that were already sent in the report to the recipient domain, so we don't report twice.

Fields.Name: SentToPolicyDomain
Fields.Docs: Set after sending report to policy domain.

Fields.Name: Results
Fields.Docs: Results is updated for each TLS attempt.

Structs.Name: TLSRPTSuppressAddress
Structs.Docs:
SuppressAddress is a reporting address for which outgoing TLS reports
will be suppressed for a period.

Structs.Name: Dynamic
Structs.Docs: Dynamic is the parsed form of domains.conf, and is automatically reloaded when changed.

Structs.Name: TLSPublicKey
Structs.Docs:
TLSPublicKey is a public key for use with TLS client authentication based on the
public key of the certificate.

Fields.Name: Fingerprint
Fields.Docs: Raw-url-base64-encoded Subject Public Key Info of certificate.

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Docs: Descriptive name to identify the key, e.g. the device where key is used.

Fields.Name: NoIMAPPreauth
Fields.Docs: If set, new immediate authenticated TLS connections are not moved to "authenticated" state. For clients that don't understand it, and will try an authenticate command anyway.

Fields.Name: Account
Fields.Docs: Key authenticates this account.

Fields.Name: LoginAddress
Fields.Docs: Must belong to account.

Structs.Name: LoginAttempt
Structs.Docs:
LoginAttempt is a successful or failed login attempt, stored for auditing
purposes.

At most 10000 failed attempts are stored per account, to prevent unbounded
growth of the database by third parties.

Fields.Name: Key
Fields.Docs: Hash of all fields after "Count" below. We store a single entry per key, updating its Last and Count fields.

Fields.Name: Last
Fields.Docs: Last has an index for efficient removal of entries after 30 days.

Fields.Name: Count
Fields.Docs: Number of login attempts for the combination of fields below.

Fields.Name: AccountName
Fields.Docs: Admin logins use "(admin)". If no account is known, "-" is used. AccountName has an index for efficiently removing failed login attempts at the end of the list when there are too many, and for efficiently removing all records for an account.

Fields.Name: LoginAddress
Fields.Docs: Empty for attempts to login in as admin.

Fields.Name: TLS
Fields.Docs: Empty if no TLS, otherwise contains version, algorithm, properties, etc.

Fields.Name: Protocol
Fields.Docs: "submission", "imap", "webmail", "webaccount", "webadmin"

Fields.Name: UserAgent
Fields.Docs: From HTTP header, or IMAP ID command.

Fields.Name: AuthMech
Fields.Docs: "plain", "login", "cram-md5", "scram-sha-256-plus", "(unrecognized)", etc

Strings.Name: DMARCPolicy
Strings.Docs: Policy as used in DMARC DNS record for "p=" or "sp=".

Strings.Name: Align
Strings.Docs: Align specifies the required alignment of a domain name.

Values.Name: AlignStrict
Values.Docs: Strict requires an exact domain name match.

Values.Name: AlignRelaxed
Values.Docs: Relaxed requires either an exact or subdomain name match.

Strings.Name: RUA
Strings.Docs:
RUA is a reporting address with scheme and special characters ",", "!" and
";" not encoded.

Strings.Name: Mode
Strings.Docs: Mode indicates how the policy should be interpreted.

Values.Name: ModeEnforce
Values.Docs: Policy must be followed, i.e. deliveries must fail if a TLS connection cannot be made.

Values.Name: ModeTesting
Values.Docs: In case TLS cannot be negotiated, plain SMTP can be used, but failures must be reported, e.g. with TLSRPT.

Values.Name: ModeNone
Values.Docs: In case MTA-STS is not or no longer implemented.

Strings.Name: Localpart
Strings.Docs:
Localpart is a decoded local part of an email address, before the "@".
For quoted strings, values do not hold the double quote or escaping backslashes.
An empty string can be a valid localpart.
Localparts are in Unicode NFC.

Strings.Name: IP
Strings.Docs:
An IP is a single IP address, a slice of bytes.
Functions in this package accept either 4-byte (IPv4)
or 16-byte (IPv6) slices as input.

Note that in this documentation, referring to an
IP address as an IPv4 address or an IPv6 address
is a semantic property of the address, not just the
length of the byte slice: a 16-byte slice can still
be an IPv4 address.

Strings.Name: AuthResult
Strings.Docs: AuthResult is the result of a login attempt.
